title: What's News: Business & Finance
text:
Meta Platforms, Netflix and PayPal are among the companies that will be classified as value stocks when index provider FTSE Russell rebalances its benchmarks at the close of trading Friday.

Major U.S. stock indexes climbed, with the S&P 500, Nasdaq and Dow industrials posting gains of 1%, 1.6%, and 0.6%, respectively.

Merck is pushing forward with a potential deal for Seagen, according to people familiar with the matter, in what would be one of the largest takeovers of the year.

McDonald's plans to make some of the biggest changes in decades to the franchising system that underpins its U.S. operations.

Zendesk is close to a deal with a group of buyout firms, according to people familiar with the matter, resurrecting an attempt to sell itself.

A U.S. appeals court threw out a $1.9 billion patent judgment against Cisco, saying the judge in the original case should have disqualified himself after learning his wife owned stock in the firm.

What's News: Business & Finance
